intro: Ditassa saxatilis, commonly known as the rock sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in dune environments and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong coastal winds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
